The Port of Tilbury has announced an exclusive partnership with Frontier Agriculture, the UK’s largest crop inputs and grain marketing business. The strategic partnership will strengthen the grain terminal business at the Port with Frontier Agriculture exporting from the terminal.

The partnership, which will see a significant amount of grain exported from the Port of Tilbury every year, was marked with the vessel, Aasfjord, loading 6,000 tonnes of feed wheat destined for Rotterdam at the Port.

“We are delighted that Frontier is now fully on board as our long term strategic partner at Tilbury’s grain terminal. The terminal is one of the UK’s largest for both export and UK markets. We are excited about this partnership with Frontier and the opportunities that this will bring to growers in the region, consumer customers and to the grain terminal itself.”
Peter Ward, Senior Asset Manager from The Port of Tilbury

“On the same day that we officially took control of the grain terminal at Tilbury, we sold our first boat, very much demonstrating our commitment to growers in the South East.”
Marc Rogerson, wheat trader at Frontier

Supplying new export opportunities
The UK has underperformed in terms of exports leaving a surplus of grain that needs to be moved. Working from the Port of Tilbury means that Frontier can offer a range of new markets and strengthen export links. The grain terminal at the Port of Tilbury is one of the UK’s largest, handling crops for export and UK markets.

“We have trade links to consumers in every importing continent, opening up new options for South East farmers.
Working with Tilbury means that we are able to offer a range of new markets and strengthen our position in terms of global exports. We have the insight to look where in the world the value is, and can base our trading on that knowledge, generating the best possible returns for growers.”
Marc Rogerson, wheat trader at Frontier

“We have an excellent relationship with Frontier and their previous joint venture entities, which span over 40 years and this new long-term agreement will further strengthen our grain terminal business at Tilbury for the future.”
Charles Hammond, group chief executive of Tilbury owners Forth Ports

Facts about Tilbury’s cargo capacity

  • Number one in the UK for the movement of grain
  • The Port imports over 40% of the UK’s food products
  • Number one in the UK for the movement of construction material for plywood and general construction products
  • Number three in the UK for containers handling about 30,000 containers a month

Source [Spreng & Co]
